channel.title: Can Anyone Help With My Compiler?
channel.description: Ok well I downloaded the TestScape source and I have edited a few things. Then when I try to compile it says 'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Can anybody help me please?!? :confused:

item.title: Can Anyone Help With My Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Snaz Snaz
item.description:
@Snaz wrote:

Yea man heres what you need to do:

go to Start>(Right click) My computer> Properties > Advanced system settings > ‘Advanced’ Tab > Environmental Vriables

or if that doesn’t work for you, Just look for the System Properties if you know where it is.

Once you found Evnironmental Variables, open it up and in the second box make a new variable:

Variable name: CLASSPATH
Variable value: .;CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;

Make another New variable:

Variable name: Path
Variable value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;

**Yea make sure you change that to your version of Java

Btw, before making the new variables, just check you havn’t already got them, if so - Then Edit them.

If you get stuck, please reply.

Read full topic
item.source: Can Anyone Help With My Compiler?

item.title: Can Anyone Help With My Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @supahN33bScape supahN33bScape
item.description:
@supahN33bScape wrote:

Ya that would be nice could u tell me[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 24, 2009, 11:59:08 pm[/size][hr]Ok i put in the code and I have JDK Update 16 but it still wont let me compile…
And I have the ClassPath and Path
Do I have to set up a path for java?

Read full topic
item.source: Can Anyone Help With My Compiler?

item.title: Can Anyone Help With My Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Snaz Snaz
item.description:
@Snaz wrote:

You most probably need to set your variables. Reply if you want me to tell you how to set your variables.

Read full topic
item.source: Can Anyone Help With My Compiler?

item.title: Can Anyone Help With My Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @0wn3r_k4t3 0wn3r k4t3
item.description:
@0wn3r_k4t3 wrote:

Ok, Right Click Compiler > Edit
Put this in

@echo off COLOR 09 cls :menu title Runserver + Compiler version 1.2 echo Please choose an option below to do that function. echo Keep posted on the Moparscape Tutorials section for echo any updates that I post. echo. echo c - Compile your server. echo r - To run your server. echo e - To exit out of the program. echo. echo. set /p compile=Option: if %compile%==c goto compile if %compile%==C goto compile if %compile%==r goto run if %compile%==R goto run if %compile%==e goto end if %compile%==E goto end if %compile#==* goto error goto error :compile cls title Compiler if defined javac (goto compile2) else (goto checkjavac) :compile2 if exist *.java (goto compile3) else (goto compileerror) :compile3 %javac% -cp . *.java pause cls goto menu :compileerror cls echo You need to have Java files for this compiler to compile. pause cls goto menu :run cls title Runserver if exist .\server.class (goto run2) else (goto servererror) :run2 set java=java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar cls goto run3 :run3 %java% server pause cls goto menu :servererror cls title Error echo You do not have a Server.class. Make sure that you have used the echo compiler with your server BEFORE you try running it. pause cls goto menu :error cls title Error echo Invalid command. Please make sure the commands you type echo in are correct. pause cls goto menu :end cls exit :checkjavac if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac) else (goto checkjavac2) :checkjavac2 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac2) else (goto checkjavac3) :checkjavac3 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac3) else (goto checkjavac4) :checkjavac4 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac4) else (goto checkjavac5) :checkjavac5 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac5) else (goto checkjavac6) :checkjavac6 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac6) else (goto checkjavac7) :checkjavac7 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac7) else (goto checkjavac8) :checkjavac8 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac8) else (goto checkjavac9) :checkjavac9 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac9) else (goto checkjavac10) :checkjavac10 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac10) else (goto checkjavac11) :checkjavac11 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac11) else (goto checkjavac12) :checkjavac12 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" (goto setjavac12) else (goto javacerror) :setjavac set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac2 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac3 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac4 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac5 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac6 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac7 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac8 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac9 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac10 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac11 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :setjavac12 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" goto compile2 :javacerror cls title Error echo You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0. Go to Mod Taharok's tutorial echo on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for a direct link to download echo the newest JDK Update. pause cls goto menu

And Replace all jdk1.6.0_16
With your Jdk
